content: The Act titled "Weather Mitigation Research and Technology Transfer Authorization Act of 2007" aims to establish a national weather mitigation policy and research program. The Act establishes definitions for key terms such as "Board," "Executive Director," "research and development," and "weather mitigation." Artificial methods control atmospheric cloud forms and precipitation in the troposphere, including rain enhancement, snowpack augmentation, and hail suppression. The Weather Mitigation Advisory and Research Board is established. The Weather Mitigation Advisory and Research Board in the Department of Commerce consists of 11 members appointed by the Secretary of Commerce, including representatives from various organizations such as the American Meteorological Society, American Society of Civil Engineers, National Academy of Sciences, and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. The Weather Mitigation Advisory and Research Board in the Department of Commerce consists of 11 members appointed by the Secretary of Commerce, including representatives from institutions of higher education, research institutes, and states supporting weather mitigation projects. Members serve at the pleasure of the Secretary and vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Board may establish advisory committees to advise on legislation, policies, research, and other matters, and must hold its first meeting within 30 days of all members being appointed. The Weather Mitigation Advisory and Research Board, consisting of 11 members appointed by the Secretary of Commerce, must hold its first meeting after all members are appointed. The Board will meet at the Chair's call, with a majority forming a quorum. A Chair and Vice Chair will be selected from the Board members. The duties of the Weather Mitigation Advisory and Research Board include holding meetings, forming a quorum with a majority, and selecting a Chair and Vice Chair from the Board members. The Weather Mitigation Advisory and Research Board promotes and funds research on improved forecast technologies and assessments of weather mitigation efficacy. They utilize the Weather Mitigation Research and Development Fund for financial assistance. The Weather Mitigation Research and Development Fund is used to cover administration expenses and fund research on weather mitigation through grants or contracts with public or private agencies. The Board must submit biennial reports on their findings and research results to the Secretary of Commerce. The Board has powers related to weather mitigation research and development. The Board has the authority to conduct studies, investigations, and hearings, employ necessary personnel, cooperate with other agencies, and enter into cooperative agreements for weather mitigation activities or cloud-seeding operations. The Executive Director, with Board approval, may conduct research and development activities related to weather mitigation or cloud-seeding. SEC. 7. COOPERATION WITH THE WEATHER MITIGATION OPERATIONS AND RESEARCH BOARD. The heads of US departments, agencies, and other entities receiving research funds must support the Board and conduct independent research on weather mitigation. SEC. 8. FUNDING. The Weather Mitigation Research and Development Fund is established within the Treasury of the United States, funded through appropriations or gifts. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2015, with funds remaining available until expended. The Board may also accept gifts or donations of services or property.
